abstract.t: This specification defines mechanisms for dynamically binding authenticators with authorization servers. Once bound, an authenticator can be used for strong authorization within OAuth 2.0.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: In order for an OAuth 2.0 authorization server to enforce strong authorization, it must associate resource owners with one or more authenticators capable of responding to a strong authorization challenge. This specification describes how an authenticator can be dynamically bound with an authorization server to obtain this information.
